content.description:
Southie State of Mind climbs a slight overhang on poor rock. Despite the rock quality, the movement is quite enjoyable.

Sit start with an incut right hand edge and a bad left hand bump with a decent thumb-catch. From there, reach a left hand crimp, move the right up to a mini-pinch, stick a big right hand to a crimp, and follow with the left hand to a three-finger slot. At that point, stick another big move to a crimp, match on it, then work up the remaining features to top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work, the immediate landing is great, but there is a rock back and right of where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the southeast face of Nosebleed.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the diagonal edge. From there, move and match hands on the jug/sidepull at the arete, reach a right hand crimp on the face, set the feet, dyno to the lip,  and finish through the false top to reach the true top.
content.protection: A pad or two will be fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the slightly overhanging west side of the northwest arete on Nosebleed.

content.description:
Fire Is Always Hungry climbs an overhanging face on an assortment of edges, jugs, and slopers. The rock quality really surprised me on this one, instead of being friable, it actually turned out to be very solid.

Stand start with hands matched on the jug/rail below the overhang. From there, move up and slight right to a pocket and jagged edge, then come back slight left through a series of incut edges and sloping jugs, and finish up the highly featured slab to top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the west facing overhang of Nosebleed.
